step.title: Transporting batteries without equipment by land

paragraph.htmltext:
Cells transported without equipment

LITHIUM ION CELLS - Fully regulated cells

Applies to:

  • Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 20 Wh/cell
  • Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 20 Wh/cell, transported in quantities exceeding 8 cells per package

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.
  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

  • Each cell incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each cell is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.

Transport mode: ADR

Packing instructions: P903

  • Cells must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging which could cause a short circuit.
  • Cells must be packed so that they are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the cells within the packaging.
  • Use only approved packaging conforming to PG II performance level.

Packagings:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H1, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Weight limit: No limit

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: Chapter 1.1.3.6 limit ≤ 333 kg Net

Marking: UN3480

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion cells fully regulated; Li-ion Wh raging 25 Wh/cell – Net weight 15 kg

LITHIUM ION CELLS - Small cells partially exempted

Applies to: Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 20 Wh/cell

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

IATA ONLY

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Transport mode: ADR

Exemption conditions: SP 188

Cells must be protected so as to prevent short circuits, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Cells must be packed in inner packagings that completely encloses the cell. The inner packaging must be packed in strong outer packagings.

Packing instructions:

Not required approved packaging. Use strong outer packaging, it must be capable of withstanding a 1.2 m drop test in any orientation without damage to cells contained therein, without shifting of the contents so as to allow cell to cell contact and without release of contents.

Weight limit: 30 kg Gross

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

  • an indication that the package contains "lithium ion cells”
  • an indication that the package shall be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • an indication that special procedures shall be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include. Inspection and repacking if necessary;
  • a telephone number for additional information;

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document is not required

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion cells;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

Modules and Packs transported without equipment

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES – Fully regulated batteries

Applies to: Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 100 Wh/cell

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • Each battery incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each battery is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Each battery containing cells or series of cells connected in parallel must be equipped with an effective means, as necessary, to prevent dangerous reverse current flow (e.g. diodes, fuses).
  • Batteries manufactured after 31 December 2011 must be marked with the Wh rating on the outside case.

Transport mode: ADR

Packaging instructions: P903

Batteries must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Batteries must be packed so that are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the batteries within the packaging.

Use only approved packaging confirming to packaging group II performance level.

Packaging:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H1, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Batteries ≥ 12 kg (gross) with strong impact resistant outer casing: Not required UN approved packagings for batteries, or assemblies or such batteries, when packed in strong outer packagings or protective enclosures (i.e. fully enclosed or wooden slatted crates).

Allowed transport on Pallets or other handling devices.

Batteries must be secured to prevent inadvertent movement, and the ternminals shall not support the weight of other superimposed elements.

Weight limit: No limit

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: chapter 1.1.3.6 – limit ≤333 kg Net

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages: UN 3481

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion batteries fully regulated packed: Li-ion Wh rating 120 Wh/cell – Net weight 15 kg
